activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Theodore S. Gans Jr.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Theodore S. Gans Jr.
Current: 2710 Germond Rd, Rhinelander, WI 54501 United States  (Effective: 10-24-2022)
Prior: 110 Woodland Heights Mnr, Rhinelander, WI 54501

Defendant must reside with grandmother, follow all household rules established by grandmother and fairness of rules be determined by grandmother, no use any profane language directed to his grandmother, and not leave his grandmother's property unless for purposes of appts/medical//mental health or aoda treatment or specially scheduled visitations with his child as arranged by/through Social Services.  Absolutely no contact with E.P. of any kind unless through 3rd party for purposes of seeing child

11:30 AM Defendant Theodore S. Gans Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Theodore S. Gans Jr.  Attorney Michael William Schiek in court for State of Wisconsin. Also calling 22CF229, 22CF230 and 22CM116.  Court goes over record and notes case 22CF229  that there is a conflict and private attorney has not been appointed yet.  Atty Magallones states State made global offer and defendant needs time to think about it.  Atty Magallones  states that 22CF230 is the controlling case and asks that court remove jury trial scheduled for next week for case 22CM116 and asks that all cases be set over together for another pretrial conference.  Court questions Atty Schiek - agrees that jury trial should be taken off - court takes jury off calendar.  Atty Magallones statement to bond/Atty Schiek statement to bond.  Court notes defendant's mother in court and questions defendant's mother regarding getting defendant to and from appts/court etc.  Court amends bond in both felony matters and orders defendant must reside with grandmother, follow all household rules established by grandmother and fairness of rules be determined by grandmother, no use any profane language directed to his grandmother, and not leave his grandmother's property unless for purposes of appts medical//mental health or aoda treatment or specially scheduled visitations with his child as arranged by/through Social Services.  Absolutely no contact with Emily Prien of any kind unless through 3rd party for purposes of seeing child. Court authorizes $10,000 sig bonds in both felony cases and sets over for PTC on January 3, 2023 at 1:30 p.m. adj: 11:47 a.m.

08:36 AM Defendant Theodore S. Gans Jr. appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Theodore S. Gans Jr. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 22CF230 & 22CF229. 22CF230 set for a preliminary hearing. State calls Town of Three Lakes Police Officer Joshua Baughman/sworn/direct by Schiek/witness identifies Defendant/continued direct by Schiek/cross by Magallones/witness is excused. Court finds probable cause exists and binds Defendant over. Schiek states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Magallones not appointed on 22CF229. Magallones willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Bond continued. adj. 08:47 PM
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:07 AM Defendant Theodore S. Gans Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Theodore S. Gans Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Calling 22cf229 for status and 22cf230 for preliminary.
Schiek statement to Witness being unavailable for prelim on 22cf230 - request new date.  Magallones statement. 
Magallones statement to bail - Schiek statement - Court statement- Bail continued in both cases.
Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No direct contact with E.P. - arrangements can be made through 3rd party to address parental needs

1:31 PM Defendant Theodore S. Gans Jr. in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Mary M. Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Breanna Magallones in court - will represent if no conflict. In receipt of complaint. Magallones requests to set 22CF230 for preliminary hearing. Sowinski/Magallones statement to bond. Court sets bond. adj. 01:39 PM
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
